title: A workflow for creating translation tables
text: example, ’ll create translation table variables gss_cat, data table General Social Survey include package forcats. ’s look gss_cat: Numerical variables—year, age, tvhours don’t need translation, factor-based variables . (careful! text variables, like names, geographic locations, organizations, might need translated, depending context languages involved.) code creates short list variable names: work transcats, set source language English name destination languages using set_source_lang set_dest_lang_list, choosing Spanish French. Note language codes two-letter shortcodes convention, requirement. Just work consistent across project. may also use longer language codes, modify language codes indicate variations. package uses r_variable language code designate variable names.
code: library(forcats) # loads gss_cat  forcats::gss_cat #> # A tibble: 21,483 × 9 #>     year marital         age race  rincome        partyid    relig denom tvhours #>    <int> <fct>         <int> <fct> <fct>          <fct>      <fct> <fct>   <int> #>  1  2000 Never married    26 White $8000 to 9999  Ind,near … Prot… Sout…      12 #>  2  2000 Divorced         48 White $8000 to 9999  Not str r… Prot… Bapt…      NA #>  3  2000 Widowed          67 White Not applicable Independe… Prot… No d…       2 #>  4  2000 Never married    39 White Not applicable Ind,near … Orth… Not …       4 #>  5  2000 Divorced         25 White Not applicable Not str d… None  Not …       1 #>  6  2000 Married          25 White $20000 - 24999 Strong de… Prot… Sout…      NA #>  7  2000 Never married    36 White $25000 or more Not str r… Chri… Not …       3 #>  8  2000 Divorced         44 White $7000 to 7999  Ind,near … Prot… Luth…      NA #>  9  2000 Married          44 White $25000 or more Not str d… Prot… Other       0 #> 10  2000 Married          47 White $25000 or more Strong re… Prot… Sout…       3 #> # ℹ 21,473 more rows # select names of all of the factor and character variables # in gss_cat gss_cat %>% dplyr::select(where(~ is.factor(.x) || is.character(.x))) %>%   names() -> gss_cat_trans_variables gss_cat %>% dplyr::select(where(~ is.numeric(.x))) %>%   names() -> gss_cat_num_variables  gss_cat_trans_variables #> [1] "marital" "race"    "rincome" "partyid" "relig"   "denom" set_source_lang("en") set_dest_lang_list(c("es", "fr"))

title: A workflow for creating translation tables
text: Translation transcats done manually created verified translation tables possible value variable question. function create_blank_translation_table creates table one variable: slightly differently named create_blank_translation_tables (final s) creates cluster tables, given list variables. default, merges tables one long dataframe can exported translation hand. different preferences, table can put directly transcats preferred translation table-list format. (blank entries mean won’t work translation.)
code: marital_trans_table <- create_blank_translation_table(gss_cat, "marital") marital_trans_table #>              en es fr #> 1     No answer       #> 2 Never married       #> 3     Separated       #> 4      Divorced       #> 5       Widowed       #> 6       Married gss_translation_combined <- create_blank_translation_tables(gss_cat,                                                             gss_cat_trans_variables) gss_translation_combined #>                en es fr #> 1         marital -- -- #> 2       No answer       #> 3   Never married       #> 4       Separated       #> 5        Divorced       #> 6         Widowed       #> 7         Married       #> 8            race -- -- #> 9           Other       #> 10          Black       #> 11          White       #> 12 Not applicable       #> 13        rincome -- -- #>  [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.print") -- omitted 75 rows ] gss_translation <- create_blank_translation_tables(gss_cat, gss_cat_trans_variables, combine_tables = FALSE) gss_translation  #> $marital #>              en es fr #> 1       marital -- -- #> 2     No answer       #> 3 Never married       #> 4     Separated       #> 5      Divorced       #> 6       Widowed       #> 7       Married       #>  #> $race #>               en es fr #> 1           race -- -- #> 2          Other       #> 3          Black       #> 4          White       #> 5 Not applicable       #>  #> $rincome #>               en es fr #> 1        rincome -- -- #> 2      No answer       #> 3     Don't know       #> 4        Refused       #> 5 $25000 or more       #> 6 $20000 - 24999       #> 7 $15000 - 19999       #> 8 $10000 - 14999       #>  [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.print") -- omitted 9 rows ] #>  #> $partyid #>                   en es fr #> 1            partyid -- -- #> 2          No answer       #> 3         Don't know       #> 4        Other party       #> 5  Strong republican       #> 6 Not str republican       #> 7       Ind,near rep       #> 8        Independent       #>  [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.print") -- omitted 3 rows ] #>  #> $relig #>                        en es fr #> 1                   relig -- -- #> 2               No answer       #> 3              Don't know       #> 4 Inter-nondenominational       #> 5         Native american       #> 6               Christian       #> 7      Orthodox-christian       #> 8            Moslem/islam       #>  [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.print") -- omitted 9 rows ] #>  #> $denom #>                     en es fr #> 1                denom -- -- #> 2            No answer       #> 3           Don't know       #> 4      No denomination       #> 5                Other       #> 6            Episcopal       #> 7   Presbyterian-dk wh       #> 8 Presbyterian, merged       #>  [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.print") -- omitted 23 rows ]

title: A workflow for creating translation tables
text: Now can write combined table external file, available editing via external text editor spreadsheet program. Editing hand, using machine translation editing results, fill table.  completed .csv can imported back R. Use parse_combined_translation_table turn combined list transcats list translation tables. imported translation table now available data translation using translated_join_vars.
code: do_not_run <- TRUE  if(!do_not_run){ readr::write_excel_csv(   gss_translation_combined,   "inst/extdata/gss_cat_transtable.csv") } library(fs)  gss_translation_combined <-    readr::read_csv(fs::path_package("extdata", "gss_cat_transtable_complete.csv",                                          package = "transcats")) #> Rows: 86 Columns: 3 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "," #> chr (3): en, es, fr #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. gss_translation <- parse_combined_translation_table(gss_translation_combined) gss_translation #> $marital #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   en            es            fr             #>   <chr>         <chr>         <chr>          #> 1 Never married Nunca se casó Jamais marié.e #> 2 Divorced      Divorciada/o  Divorcé.e      #> 3 Widowed       Viuda/o       Veuf/Veuve     #> 4 Married       Casada/o      Marié.e        #> 5 Separated     Separada/o    Séparé.e       #> 6 No answer     Sin respuesta Pas de réponse #>  #> $race #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   en    es       fr       #>   <chr> <chr>    <chr>    #> 1 White Blanca/o Blanc.he #> 2 Black Negra/o  Noir.e   #> 3 Other Otro     Autre    #>  #> $rincome #> # A tibble: 16 × 3 #>    en             es              fr             #>    <chr>          <chr>           <chr>          #>  1 $8000 to 9999  $8000 a 9999    $8000 à 9999   #>  2 Not applicable No aplicable    Non applicable #>  3 $20000 - 24999 $20000 a 24999  $20000 à 24999 #>  4 $25000 or more $25000 o más    $25000 ou plus #>  5 $7000 to 7999  $7000 a 7999    $7000 à 7999   #>  6 $10000 - 14999 $10000 a 14999  $10000 à 14999 #>  7 Refused        Rechazado       Refusé         #>  8 $15000 - 19999 $15000 a 19999  $15000 à 19999 #>  9 $3000 to 3999  $3000 a 3999    $3000 à 3999   #> 10 $5000 to 5999  $5000 a 5999    $5000 à 5999   #> 11 Don't know     No sabe         Ne sait pas    #> 12 $1000 to 2999  $1000 a 2999    $1000 à 2999   #> 13 Lt $1000       Menos que $1000 Moins de $1000 #> 14 No answer      Sin respuesta   Pas de réponse #> 15 $6000 to 6999  $6000 a 6999    $6000 à 6999   #> 16 $4000 to 4999  $4000 a 4999    $4000 à 4999   #>  #> $partyid #> # A tibble: 10 × 3 #>    en                 es                                fr                       #>    <chr>              <chr>                             <chr>                    #>  1 Ind,near rep       Independiente, casi republicana/o Indépendant.e, proche d… #>  2 Not str republican Republicana/o, no fuerte          Républicain.e, pas fort… #>  3 Independent        Independiente                     Indépendant.e            #>  4 Not str democrat   Demócrata, no fuerte              Démocrate, pas fort.e    #>  5 Strong democrat    Demócrata  fuerte                 Démocrate fort.e         #>  6 Ind,near dem       Independiente, casi demócrata     Indépendant.e, proche d… #>  7 Strong republican  Republicana/o fuerte              Républicain.e fort.e     #>  8 Other party        Otro partido                      Autre parti politique    #>  9 No answer          Sin respuesta                     Pas de réponse           #> 10 Don't know         No sabe                           Ne sait pas              #>  #> $relig #> # A tibble: 15 × 3 #>    en                      es                     fr                       #>    <chr>                   <chr>                  <chr>                    #>  1 Protestant              Protestante            Protestant               #>  2 Orthodox-christian      Cristiano ortodoxo     Chrétien orthodoxe       #>  3 None                    Ninguno                Aucune religion          #>  4 Christian               Cristiano              Chrétien                 #>  5 Jewish                  Judío                  Juif                     #>  6 Catholic                Católico               Catholique               #>  7 Other                   Otro                   Autre                    #>  8 Inter-nondenominational Interconfesional       Interconfessionnel       #>  9 Hinduism                Hindú                  Hindou                   #> 10 Native american         Indígena americano     Amérindien               #> 11 No answer               Sin respuesta          Pas de réponse           #> 12 Buddhism                Budista                Bouddhiste               #> 13 Moslem/islam            Musulmán               Musulman                 #> 14 Other eastern           Otra religión oriental Autre religion orientale #> 15 Don't know              No sabe                Ne sait pas              #>  #> $denom #> # A tibble: 30 × 3 #>    en                es                               fr                         #>    <chr>             <chr>                            <chr>                      #>  1 Southern baptist  Bautista del Sur                 Baptiste du Sud            #>  2 Baptist-dk which  Bautista, no sabe cuál           Baptiste, ne sait pas leq… #>  3 No denomination   Sin denominación                 Aucune dénomination        #>  4 Not applicable    No corresponde                   Sans objet                 #>  5 Lutheran-mo synod Sínodo luterano-misuri           Synode luthérien-Missouri  #>  6 Other             Otro                             Autre                      #>  7 United methodist  Metodista unido                  Méthodiste uni             #>  8 Episcopal         Episcopal                        Épiscopal                  #>  9 Other lutheran    Otro luterano                    Autre luthérien            #> 10 Afr meth ep zion  African Methodist Episcopal Zion Méthodiste africain Épisc… #> # ℹ 20 more rows

title: A workflow for creating translation tables
text: Let’s compare input output:
code: set_active_translation_table(gss_translation) set_source_lang("en") set_dest_lang("fr") gss_cat_2 <- translated_join_vars(gss_cat, gss_cat_trans_variables)  gss_cat_fr <- gss_cat_2 %>% dplyr::select(-all_of(gss_cat_trans_variables))  # reorder to match original gss_cat_fr <- gss_cat_fr %>% dplyr::relocate(age, .after="marital_fr") %>%                              dplyr::relocate(tvhours, .after="denom_fr")  # gss_cat_fr_variables <- g knitr::kable(head(gss_cat, 12)) knitr::kable(head(gss_cat_fr, 12))

what: Translate Categorical Data Using Translation Tables
title: Translate Categorical Data Using Translation Tables
text: goal transcats translate variable names titles values dataframes containing containing categorical data. translations made using editable translation tables allow users edit verify translations.

title: Translate Categorical Data Using Translation Tables
text: can install development version transcats GitHub :

title: Translate Categorical Data Using Translation Tables
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(transcats) ## basic example code names(forcats::gss_cat) #> [1] "year"    "marital" "age"     "race"    "rincome" "partyid" "relig"   #> [8] "denom"   "tvhours" set_title_lang("es") set_var_name_table(gss_var_table) variable_names_vector(forcats::gss_cat) #> [1] "año de la encuesta"              "estado civil"                    #> [3] "edad"                            "raza"                            #> [5] "ingresos declarados"             "afiliación partidaria"           #> [7] "religión"                        "denominación"                    #> [9] "horas diarias viendo televisión"

title: Translate Categorical Data Using Translation Tables
text: ’s longer workflow translating categorical data (see vignette “workflow creating translation tables”), net result full translation categorical data.

what: Add translated levels to a list object — add_translated_levels
title: Add translated levels to a list object — add_translated_levels
text: Translate levels vector categorical factor add list object.

title: Add translated levels to a list object — add_translated_levels
Add translated levels to a list object — add_translated_levels
text: list_obj list object containing levels translated. ... Additional arguments passed translated_levels function.

title: Add translated levels to a list object — add_translated_levels
text: modified version variable description list object translated levels added.

title: Add translated levels to a list object — add_translated_levels
code: p_domain <- list(  levels = c("Coca", "Contraband", "Education") ) add_translated_levels(p_domain, variable = "protest_domain", uc_translation) #> $levels #> [1] "Coca"       "Contraband" "Education"  #>  #> $levels_es #> [1] "Coca"        "Contrabando" "Educación"   #>

what: Append new entries to variable_name_table — append_to_var_name_table
title: Append new entries to variable_name_table — append_to_var_name_table
text: Adds extension translation table existing one. Put extension first (makes piping function easier). default, active translation table one appended . However, must pipe set_var_name_table() want put extended table use.

title: Append new entries to variable_name_table — append_to_var_name_table
code: append_to_var_name_table(   extension,   table = tcats$var_name_table,   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Append new entries to variable_name_table — append_to_var_name_table
text: extension matching variable translation table one column named language languages table', necessarily order. (extension may additional languages, dropped.) table variable translation table one column named language overwrite flag indicating whether entries overlap two tables overwritten value extension. Default value FALSE, indicating change made.

title: Append new entries to variable_name_table — append_to_var_name_table
text: longer variable translation table

title: Append new entries to variable_name_table — append_to_var_name_table
code: n_trans_table <- tibble::tribble(  ~language, ~date, ~age, ~n, ~n_state_perp, ~n_state_victim, ~n_state_separate, ~deaths,  "en", "Date", "Age", "Confirmed", "State Perp", "State Victim", "Sep from State", "Deaths",  "es", "Fecha", "Edad", "Confirmado", "Perp x Estado", "Víctima Estatal",    "Ajeno del Estado", "Muertes",  "r_variable", "date", "age", "n", "n_state_perp", "n_state_victim",    "n_state_separate", "deaths") append_to_var_name_table(n_trans_table, uc_var_table) #> # A tibble: 3 × 70 #>   language   event_title    unconfirmed year  month day   later_year later_month #>   <chr>      <chr>          <chr>       <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr>      <chr>       #> 1 en         Event identif… Unconfirme… Year  Month Day   Year of D… Month of D… #> 2 es         Identificador… No confirm… Año   Mes   Día   Año de Mu… Mes de Mue… #> 3 r_variable event_title    unconfirmed year  month day   later_year later_month #> # ℹ 62 more variables: later_day <chr>, dec_firstname <chr>, #> #   dec_surnames <chr>, id_indiv <chr>, dec_age <chr>, dec_alt_age <chr>, #> #   dec_gender <chr>, dec_ethnicity <chr>, dec_residence <chr>, #> #   dec_nationality <chr>, dec_affiliation <chr>, dec_spec_affiliation <chr>, #> #   dec_title <chr>, cause_death <chr>, cause_medical <chr>, munition <chr>, #> #   weapon <chr>, victim_armed <chr>, perp_category <chr>, perp_group <chr>, #> #   perp_firstname <chr>, perp_surname <chr>, perp_pol_stalemate <chr>, … append_to_var_name_table(gss_var_table, uc_var_table)[c(1,6,71)] #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   language   day   tvhours                         #>   <chr>      <chr> <chr>                           #> 1 en         Day   hours per day watching tv       #> 2 es         Día   horas diarias viendo televisión #> 3 r_variable day   tvhours

what: Create one blank translation table — create_blank_translation_table
title: Create one blank translation table — create_blank_translation_table
text: Creates blank translation table single variable data frame.

title: Create one blank translation table — create_blank_translation_table
code: create_blank_translation_table(   dataframe,   variable,   source_lang = tcats$source_lang,   dest_language_list = tcats$dest_lang_list )

title: Create one blank translation table — create_blank_translation_table
text: dataframe Dataframe whose columns variables variable Single variable among columns, passed string source_lang Code source language; head left column output dest_language_list Codes, list strings, translated

title: Create one blank translation table — create_blank_translation_table
text: Data frame possible values variable source language blank fill translations

title: Create one blank translation table — create_blank_translation_table
text: Left column, named source_lang original values. variable factor, levels factor. character variable, unique values variable dataframe. language dest_language_list gets column. However, source_lang list, removed. Duplicate values receive warning.

title: Create one blank translation table — create_blank_translation_table
code: create_blank_translation_tables(forcats::gss_cat, "relig",     "en", c("fr", "cz")) #>                         en fr cz #> 1                    relig -- -- #> 2                No answer       #> 3               Don't know       #> 4  Inter-nondenominational       #> 5          Native american       #> 6                Christian       #> 7       Orthodox-christian       #> 8             Moslem/islam       #> 9            Other eastern       #> 10                Hinduism       #> 11                Buddhism       #> 12                   Other       #> 13                    None       #> 14                  Jewish       #> 15                Catholic       #> 16              Protestant       #> 17          Not applicable

what: Create a composite translation table — create_blank_translation_tables
title: Create a composite translation table — create_blank_translation_tables
text: Creates blank translation table multiple variables data frame.

title: Create a composite translation table — create_blank_translation_tables
code: create_blank_translation_tables(   dataframe,   variable_list,   source_lang = tcats$source_lang,   dest_language_list = tcats$dest_lang_list,   incl_header = TRUE,   combine_tables = TRUE )

title: Create a composite translation table — create_blank_translation_tables
text: dataframe Dataframe whose columns variables variable_list List variables source_lang Code source language; head left column output dest_language_list Codes, list strings, translated incl_header true, put name variable top translation table. combine_tables true, combine translation tables single data frame. false, return single list translation tobles, variable names names list elements.

title: Create a composite translation table — create_blank_translation_tables
text: single dataframe list dataframes

title: Create a composite translation table — create_blank_translation_tables
text: combine_tables TRUE, translation tables stacked bound together single table. FALSE, returned preferred transcats form, list translation tables. left column table, named source_lang original values. variable factor, levels factor. character variable, unique values variable dataframe. language dest_language_list gets column. However, source_lang list, removed. Duplicate values receive warning.

title: Create a composite translation table — create_blank_translation_tables
code: create_blank_translation_tables(forcats::gss_cat, c("marital", "race", "relig"),     "en", c("fr", "cz")) #>                         en fr cz #> 1                  marital -- -- #> 2                No answer       #> 3            Never married       #> 4                Separated       #> 5                 Divorced       #> 6                  Widowed       #> 7                  Married       #> 8                     race -- -- #> 9                    Other       #> 10                   Black       #> 11                   White       #> 12          Not applicable       #> 13                   relig -- -- #> 14               No answer       #> 15              Don't know       #> 16 Inter-nondenominational       #> 17         Native american       #> 18               Christian       #> 19      Orthodox-christian       #> 20            Moslem/islam       #> 21           Other eastern       #> 22                Hinduism       #> 23                Buddhism       #> 24                   Other       #> 25                    None       #> 26                  Jewish       #> 27                Catholic       #> 28              Protestant       #> 29          Not applicable       create_blank_translation_tables(vcd::DanishWelfare, c("Status", "Urban"),                                 source_lang = "en",                                 dest_language_list = c("en-complete", "dk")) #>               en en-complete dk #> 1         Status          -- -- #> 2          Widow                #> 3        Married                #> 4      Unmarried                #> 5          Urban          -- -- #> 6     Copenhagen                #> 7  SubCopenhagen                #> 8      LargeCity                #> 9           City                #> 10       Country

what: transcats: Translate Categorical Data Using Translation Tables — transcats-package
title: transcats: Translate Categorical Data Using Translation Tables — transcats-package
text: Translate variable names titles values dataframes containing containing categorical data. translations made using editable translation tables allow users edit verify translations.

title: transcats: Translate Categorical Data Using Translation Tables — transcats-package
text: Maintainer: Carwil Bjork-James c.bjork-james@vanderbilt.edu (ORCID) [copyright holder]

title: Translated Join — translated_join
text: Adds one column (translated_join) several columns (translated_join_vars) right side data table, filled translations one several categorical variables.

title: Translated Join — translated_join
code: translated_join(   dataframe,   variable,   translation_table = tcats$translation_table,   dest_lang = tcats$dest_lang,   source_lang = tcats$source_lang,   .location = "right" )  translated_join_vars(dataframe, variables = c(""), ...)

title: Translated Join — translated_join
text: dataframe Data table changed variable Name variable translated, string. translation_table Consolidated translation table used (translation_table$variable translation table variable involved). dest_lang Language translated , typically short code. source_lang Language translated , typically short code. .location location "right", translated columns added right dataframe. "beside" added next translated variable. "replace", supplant translated variable. variables list variables c("firstvar", "secondvar") format. ... used pass translation_table, dest_lang, source_lang translated_join_vars translated_join

title: Translated Join — translated_join
text: modified version data table extra columns

title: Translated Join — translated_join
text: Translated variables take name original variable, plus underscore, code destination language.

text: levels_vector One-dimensional vector levels factor variable variable involved, passed string. translation_table Consolidated translation table used (translation_table$variable translation table variable involved). dest_lang Language translated , typically short code. source_lang Language translated , typically short code.

Ultimate Consequences Translation Table — uc_translation
text: translation table Ultimate Consequences data project, documents deaths Bolivian political conflict.

title: Ultimate Consequences Translation Table — uc_translation
Ultimate Consequences Translation Table — uc_translation
text: uc_translation list eight tibbles, two columns named "en" "es". names correspond categorical variables involved: protest_domain, pres_admin, dec_affiliation, perp_affiliation, cause_death, state_responsibility, intentionality, event_title

title: Ultimate Consequences Translation Table — uc_translation
text: https://ultimateconsequences.github.io/

title: Ultimate Consequences Translation Table — uc_translation
text: uc_translation <- list(protest_domain = domain_trans_table, pres_admin = pres_trans_table, dec_affiliation = affil_trans_table, perp_affiliation = affil_trans_table, cause_death = cause_trans_table, state_responsibility = sresp_trans_table, intentionality = intent_trans_table, event_title = event_trans_table) Note duplicate two variables intentional, since two variables (affiliation perpetrator victim political violence) use set possible categories.

text: Logical true false

title: Check if a language is available in a variable name table — var_name_language_available
code: var_name_language_available("fr") # examines active variable table #> [1] TRUE var_name_language_available("es", uc_var_table) #> [1] TRUE

Language-specific names for variables — variable_name_from_string
text: function outputs string naming variable based multilingual translation table. want output names multiple variables , can use function map() (use variable_name()).

title: Language-specific names for variables — variable_name_from_string
code: variable_name_from_string(   variable,   lang = tcats$title_lang,   name_table = tcats$var_name_table )

title: Language-specific names for variables — variable_name_from_string
text: variable Name variable, passed string, quotes lang Language used; use r_variable variable . name_table horizontal translation table whose column names correspond variables

title: Language-specific names for variables — variable_name_from_string
text: text string title variable, name variable r.

title: Language-specific names for variables — variable_name_from_string
code: set_var_name_table(gss_var_table) variable_name_from_string("relig", lang="es") #> [1] "religión" variable_name_from_string("partyid", lang="en") #> [1] "party affiliation" purrr::map(colnames(forcats::gss_cat), var_lang_str) #> [[1]] #> [1] "year of survey" #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] "marital status" #>  #> [[3]] #> [1] "age" #>  #> [[4]] #> [1] "race" #>  #> [[5]] #> [1] "reported income" #>  #> [[6]] #> [1] "party affiliation" #>  #> [[7]] #> [1] "religion" #>  #> [[8]] #> [1] "denomination" #>  #> [[9]] #> [1] "hours per day watching tv" #>

what: Produce a list of display names for each variables — variable_names_vector
title: Produce a list of display names for each variables — variable_names_vector
text: Using active variable name table, produce list display names variable, language currently specified tcats$title_lang (set set_title_lang()).

title: Produce a list of display names for each variables — variable_names_vector
Produce a list of display names for each variables — variable_names_vector
text: dataframe Dataframe whose columns variables listed.

title: Produce a list of display names for each variables — variable_names_vector
text: vector strings wit display names.

title: Produce a list of display names for each variables — variable_names_vector
code: set_title_lang("es") set_var_name_table(gss_var_table) variable_names_vector(forcats::gss_cat) #> [1] "año de la encuesta"              "estado civil"                    #> [3] "edad"                            "raza"                            #> [5] "ingresos declarados"             "afiliación partidaria"           #> [7] "religión"                        "denominación"                    #> [9] "horas diarias viendo televisión"
